titleInfo.title: John James Audubon Drawings and Proofs, 1840-1844

mods.note: John James Audubon (1785-1851), the most distinguished wildlife artist of the nineteenth century, published the double elephant folio edition of the Birds of America between 1827 and 1838. A complete set contained 435 hand-colored engravings. Audubon later published a less expensive edition using the lithographic process, which became known as the petite, royal octavo, or Birds in Miniature edition. It was published in installments as The Birds of America, from Drawings made in the United States and their Territories (1840-1844). These drawings and proofs are from the first octavo edition of the Birds of America.
mods.abstract: John James Audubon (1785-1851), the most distinguished wildlife artist of the nineteenth century, published the double elephant folio edition of the Birds of America between 1827 and 1838. Audubon later published a less expensive edition using the lithographic process, which was published in installments as The Birds of America, from Drawings made in the United States and their Territories (1840-1844). These drawings and proofs are from the first octavo edition of the Birds of America.
